refnamediv.refpurpose: generate numerical indices for shell loops, etc.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Loop generates a sequence of numbers between start and finish inclusive, one per line, on stdout. This is mostly useful for driving loops when writing Shell programs sh1. The default increment is +1 when start<finish, and -1 when start>finish. An optional increment may be specified. If increment is zero, then the start value will be generated continuously.

Both floating point and integer arguments can be used. On integer arguments, if leading zeros are specified, they will be preserved on output. This is useful for generating sequences of file names which are numbered with leading zeros.

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.literallayout: for i in `loop 10 30 5` do echo $i done
for i in `loop 008 005` do echo $i done
for i in `loop 0.1 2.9 0.5` do echo $i done

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: This program just scratches the surface. The shells could benefit from a greater ability to perform math. Limitless opportunities for extensions exist, but this simple version is adequate for most shell scripts dealing with sequences of images, etc.
